trackinfo.title: Struck by the rain
trackinfo.lyrics: Love has a cruel sense of fun. It never plays by the rules. It spins us both on our heads, Turns us both into fools. It leaves me on my own With tear-stained eyes, Oh, what can I do? They say that losing at love, Breaking your heart, It only makes you look Even more beautiful. I don't believe it's true, But I see you and what can I do? I wish that we could be close. Close enough to use Our real names for once, And you would say to me, "Oh, I love you so!" You'll say you won't let me go. Rain falls on me, And now I'm walking away. Tell me, do you find me More beautiful now? I'm not the kind to let You watch as I cry, So I've got to leave... I've got to forget you. And so I'll hide Myself away from the world, Leave behind the sorrow Of a sad little girl. I thought that I had finally Won at the game. You told me it just was for fun. I suppose that I was too young.

The Placeholder.title: The nothing it all turns into
The Placeholder.about:
A Side:
The greater years are recalled through a haze. Occasional lapses are inevitable, time affects us all.
B Side:
Going back to re-experience where those old memories came from, now that they all feel a bit blurry. Things have changed, but it’s all fine. It must be.
C Side:
The mental fog has grown denser. More distant memories are hazier, and closer memories have grown bitter. Family members notice, leading to a revelation.
D Side:
An ending that seemed so far away is now unbearably close. The pressure of the universe weighs down on the patient, now knowing the truth of their condition and where the rest of their life will lead them.
E Side:
Confusion is more severe. Emotions are imbalanced and familiar memories become twisted into nightmares. The patient is unable to perform more complex tasks, and may deny their own condition.
F Side:
The decline continues. The patient requires help with many regular tasks, and can become completely confused at time. The stress of caring for the patient weighs heavily on their family.
The Placeholder.credits:
released May 30, 2025
Put together, taken apart, and left to crumble to pieces by The Placeholder.
Compiled by saltliam.

The Placeholder.title: The Placeholder May-ceholder
The Placeholder.about:
Welcome to The Placeholder May-ceholder, an event where I posted a new, never before released Placeholder track every day for all of May!
Inspired by The Caretaker's Everywhere at the end of time, We'll all go riding on a rainbow, An empty bliss beyond this world, Selected memories from the haunted ballroom, and Persistent repetition of phrases, The Artifex's The Grand Decline, ArtOfLemons' A Dream of the Infinite Silence, and the works of death's dynamic shroud.wmv.
Pieced together, taken apart, and left to collect dust by The Placeholder.
